text: Hello there! Welcome to Hindi for Travelers, Lesson 1. My name is Taj and I'll be your guide on this journey to learning basic Hindi.
Awesome! Let's get started with some basic introductions. In Hindi, saying your name is "मेरा नाम" (mera nama). Try saying it back to me.
Excellent! Now, let's get right to the essence of traveling. Asking for directions.
In Hindi, the phrase for "where is..." is "यह कहाँ है?" (yah kahaan hai?). Try asking this to find the nearest train station.
Brilliant! You're picking up the language quickly. To answer the question, you'd say "भगभग 10 सितंबर का रेलवे स्टेशन यह है" (baghbagh, 10 sitambar ka relave station yah hai). Try saying it.
Outstanding! Now, let's get playful. Can you order a meal in a restaurant, asking for a special vegetarian dish?

Wow, impressive effort! Though remember, in Hindi we literally say "I am hungry" as "मैं खाना हूँ" (main khaana hun). And you asked for a special dish, so in Hindi you'd say "भिगो स्तग्न का खाना चाहिए" (Bigho stugan ka khaana chahiye).
